channel.title: I really suck
channel.description: well since i've been playing these servers and been getting my ranks in mopar i've been determined to learn java and coding, so i went to the tutorial sections by the mopar staff (for some people they're helpful) but i searched through them and they say stuff like having a batch file and java compiler already open, where do i get them? i really need help, but in a simple way, i'm dumb at java, but i'm determined to learn.

item.title: I really suck
item.dc:creator: @teric6 teric6
item.description:
@teric6 wrote:

[quote=“ThatOneServer, post:8, topic:69348”]Well, this is not a nooby forums like the runescape ones. You use capitals in your titles, and make sure you spell everything right. Also, make sure the title explains what the thread will be about. Not just ‘Help’ or ‘Error’. In the thread, add an in depth description of what it is about, containing the main idea, and the details.Just because the title says it, you need to restate it. The little things matter… If your thread was neat and organized, you would get help much faster. Once again, try harder.

Other things to avoid:

  1. Using words that are in all caps in the title (e.g. DRAGON GLITCH)
  2. Using “u” instead of “you” and “r” instead of “are” (e.g. U r the bomb!)
  3. Abbreviating words (e.g. Hlp me Plz! I cnt fx it myslf!)
  4. Double Posting (Just edit the previous post instead of posting again)
  5. Capitalizing the frirst letter in every word in a thread. It may look good at first, but it gets anoying.(e.g. This Gets Annoying Very Fast)
    ~ThatOneServer[/quote]

am i bovvered?

Read full topic

item.title: I really suck
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Well, this is not a nooby forums like the runescape ones. You use capitals in your titles, and make sure you spell everything right. Also, make sure the title explains what the thread will be about. Not just ‘Help’ or ‘Error’. In the thread, add an in depth description of what it is about, containing the main idea, and the details.Just because the title says it, you need to restate it. The little things matter… If your thread was neat and organized, you would get help much faster. Once again, try harder.

Other things to avoid:

  1. Using words that are in all caps in the title (e.g. DRAGON GLITCH)
  2. Using “u” instead of “you” and “r” instead of “are” (e.g. U r the bomb!)
  3. Abbreviating words (e.g. Hlp me Plz! I cnt fx it myslf!)
  4. Double Posting (Just edit the previous post instead of posting again)
  5. Capitalizing the frirst letter in every word in a thread. It may look good at first, but it gets anoying.(e.g. This Gets Annoying Very Fast)
    ~ThatOneServer

item.title: I really suck
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

i have a tip for you dont rush over it

first read some tutorials and try them
always have a backup from your source incase u **** it up

start with simple command
you have to learn this by falling and standing up

learning from your mistakes …

if you got an error try to solve this

you dont can code from one day to another so dont give up

it took me 3weeks before i finally mad emy first void

i hope my advise helped you and gl in coding

Read full topic

a batch file is a notepad with code in it, then you save it as “ANYTHINGHERE.bat”

use this link, this will help you:batch file help
